sentences.english: But the Democrats have lost their sixtieth vote.
sentences.chinese: 但是，民主黨人喪失了其第六十票。

sentences.english: Likewise you also have those who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
sentences.chinese: 你那裏也有人照樣服從了尼哥拉一黨人的教訓。

sentences.english: Democrats generally endorse the cap-and-trade plan in the bill.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人普遍贊同議案中的限制和貿易計劃。

sentences.english: What does Horsey think of the Democrats' fascination with Clinton?
sentences.chinese: 霍爾西是如何看待民主黨人對克林頓的迷戀呢？

sentences.english: It left examples of his complimenting Republicans on the cutting-room floor.
sentences.chinese: 它留下了他的恭維切割室地板共和黨人例子。

sentences.english: McConnell said Republicans would fight the health-care legislation as hard as they could.
sentences.chinese: 麥康奈爾說，共和黨人將竭盡全力反對健保法案。

sentences.english: Ten Democrats bolted on this vote.
sentences.chinese: 十名民主黨人在這次投票中拒絕支持本黨候選人。

sentences.english: But there's no question that Republicans were very successful at demonizing the plan.
sentences.chinese: 但是共和黨人已毫無疑問地成功妖魔化健改。

sentences.english: Republicans have the right to filibuster under centuries-old rules that this page has long defended.
sentences.chinese: 長久以來的慣例是，共和黨人有阻撓議案通過的權利。

sentences.english: Minus the "trash" there would be no Tea Baggers in Congress.
sentences.chinese: 沒有這些“垃圾”，國會也不會出現茶葉黨人。

sentences.english: Wait a minute, we thought he was a Democrat.
sentences.chinese: 稍等，我們認爲這一位是一名民主黨人。

sentences.english: Republicans have been uncertain how to respond to the visit.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨人仍不知道該如何迴應她的到訪。

sentences.english: To which there seemed no more effectual reply than to go on killing royalists.
sentences.chinese: 除了繼續殺害保王黨人，似乎沒有別的更有效的回擊。

sentences.english: At present, the Republicans are a result of domestic policy issues with Barack Obama at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 當前，共和黨人正與奧巴馬因國內政策問題相持不下。

sentences.english: It is no accident that Democrats, in particular, have been eying China as a line of attack.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人對中國的一線攻擊並不令人感到意外。

sentences.english: Democrats dismissed the moves as political gimmickry.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人將此舉斥爲政治伎倆。

definition: strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
